newsitem.title: SPAIN: Tabacalera ready to give Tabaquiera share access.
newsitem.headline: Tabacalera ready to give Tabaquiera share access.

text.p: Spanish tobacco firm Tabacalera on Thursday said it was prepared to give Portugal's Tabaqueira privileged access to its share capital when the Spanish company is privatised.
Tabacalera is currently bidding for 65 percent of Tabaquiera but Portugal has yet to announce who will be awarded the first tranche in the privatisation.
The Spanish company said if it was chosen, it would request the quotation of Tabaqueira's shares on the Lisbon bourse.

"Once the moment has arrived to privatise the Spanish firm, (we propose) that Tabaqueira be the only company with direct access in the allocation of the public share packet (of 52.3 percent of Tabacalera)," the company said in a statement.
Tabacalera on Wednesday said it would buy the remaining 35 percent of the Tabaqueira ahead of the schedule set by the Portuguese government if it was awarded the first tranche.

These new proposals follow the announcement last week that a special jury had ranked Tabacalera's offer third, despite having the highest prize, favouring U.S. concern Philip Morris and France's Seita instead.
A Portuguese Finance Ministry source told Reuters on Wednesday that a decision could be reached next week.
Tabacalera rose 35 pesetas to 4,685 by 1115 GMT. But it has lost 7.7 percent since the announcement last Friday that Philip Morris was in pole position for the privatisation.
